definitions.definition: the actual application or use of an idea, belief, or method as opposed to theories about such application or use.
examples: the principles and practice of teaching
synonyms: apply "it's time you put your teaching degree into practice"

definitions.definition: the customary, habitual, or expected procedure of something.
the carrying out or exercise of a profession, especially that of a doctor or lawyer.
examples: he abandoned medical practice for the Church

definitions.definition: the business or premises of a doctor or lawyer.
examples: Dr. Weiss has a practice in Essex

definitions.definition: an established method of legal procedure.
repeated exercise in or performance of an activity or skill so as to acquire or maintain proficiency in it.
examples: it must have taken a lot of practice to become so fluent
synonyms: run-through; informaldry run "it takes lots of practice"

definitions.definition: a period of time spent doing this.
perform (an activity) or exercise (a skill) repeatedly or regularly in order to improve or maintain one's proficiency.
examples: I need to practice my French
synonyms: perfect "he practiced the songs every day"train
go through one's paces "the performers were practicing"

definitions.definition: carry out or perform (a particular activity, method, or custom) habitually or regularly.
examples: we still practice some of these rituals today
synonyms: observe "we still practice these rituals today"

definitions.definition: actively pursue or be engaged in (a particular profession or occupation).
synonyms: pursue a career in "she practices medicine"

definitions.definition: observe the teaching and rules of (a particular religion).
examples: they are free to practice their religion without fear of persecution

definitions.definition: scheme or plot for an evil purpose.
examples: what a tangled web we weave when we first practice to deceive
